title: Oxen (The Ox) (Sweden 1991) H.264 from PAL DVD (moviesbyrizzo)
description: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0102619/ Directed by Mr. Sven Nykvist Stars Stellan Skarsgård, Ewa Fröling This is an H.264 2400k bitrate 720 X 576 video res convert of the 4GB (single layer) DVD we ordered o-line from Europe years ago. It is no longer showing as available last we checked. perhaps a blue-ray is in the works. that would be great thing I'm sure. Until then here is something to tide you over. 192k stereo AC3 Swedish audio Check for subtitles on the net please. Included in the torrent folder this time are subtitles for Bosnian Czech English Dutch English Finnish Norwegian Romanian Spanish and Swedish. This movie from Sweden is one I initially saw at a theatre in Edmonton Canada catering to the best movies from around Europe. It tells of the suffering of a Swedish Irish family after the Husband and Father does something desperate bid to keep his family alive with some food during difficult times indeed back then. The moral of the story I suggest is that when someone does something wrong, that is not a valid enough reason or excuse rather to do something insanely harsh by way of punishment in order to consider some kind of justice done. The man did err against his community at large while trying to do for his immediate family, However I don't think understanding sufficient to his spirit prevailed to make for a reasonable outcome for all concerned. Sometimes all that a good enough person needs is a talking to or a warning or even a slap on the wrist. On the other hand for those that do evil with intent to be that way (and that certainly isn't something this man should be accused of), whatever sanctions - even extreme that may apply may be insufficient to do true and real justice to serve the community in a real way. Where truly lovely spirits can be found, a lighter approach to punishments should be taken in matters such as this as that is punishment enough if the person concerned is a conscionable nice enough person to take a point and seek to improve his behaviour if he can accept the wisdom of it, which he should be able to in such a case. Michael Rizzo Chessman (moviesbyrizzo)
